message.content:
cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

This paper proposes a neural model to improve the detection performance of LPTCs in wide-field motion perception. The paper involves the use of neural networks and computer vision techniques to simulate the behavior of specialized neurons. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Additionally, the paper involves the use of artificial intelligence techniques to improve the detection performance, which makes cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a likely sub-category. The proposed mechanism also involves filtering out irrelevant motion signals, which is related to control systems and robotics, making cs.SY (Systems and Control) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the use of machine learning techniques to improve the detection performance, which makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible sub-category.
